oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Electric current induced unidirectional propagation of surface plasmon-polaritons
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bliokh, K. Y.
Rodríguez-Fortuño, F. J.
Bekshaev, A. Y.
Kivshar, Y. S.
Nori, F.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Physics - Optics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Nonreciprocity and one-way propagation of optical signals is crucial for modern nanophotonic technology, and is typically achieved using magneto-optical effects requiring large magnetic biases. Here we suggest a fundamentally novel approach to achieve unidirectional propagation of surface plasmon-polaritons (SPPs) at metal-dielectric interfaces. We employ a direct electric current in metals, which produces a Doppler frequency shift of SPPs due to the uniform drift of electrons. This tilts the SPP dispersion, enabling one-way propagation, as well as zero and negative group velocities. The results are demonstrated for planar interfaces and cylindrical nanowire waveguides.
Comment: 4 pages, 4 figures, to appear in Opt. Lett
